data.title: DePaul University Blue Demons
data.meta_description: Chico Carter Jr. (2) Guard - 2022-23 (South Carolina) Started all 25 games he played in, averaging 9.8 points, 1.8 rebounds and 1.6 assists per game before m...
data.text:
2022-23 (South Carolina)

Started all 25 games he played in, averaging 9.8 points, 1.8 rebounds and 1.6 assists per game before missing the final six games of the season with injury.

Shot 46.7 percent (49-of-103) from behind-the-arc, the top mark in the SEC.

Recorded eight games with three or more made 3s.

Had 16 points, three assists and two steals in a 60-58 rivalry win vs. Clemson (11/11) while securing the game-winning basket. Shot 4-of-6 from three-point range.

Had a season-high 26 points against Davidson, knocking down a career-best six three-pointers.

Scored 24 points in the SEC opener at Vanderbilt (1/3) with a career-high six rebounds while dishing out four assists.

Scored in double figures four more times in conference play with 12 points vs. Ole Miss (1/17), 12 points vs. Florida (1/25), 12 points at Georgia (1/28) and 15 points vs. Vanderbilt (2/14).

2021-22 (South Carolina)

Saw action in 24 games, making his lone start in a 105-75 rout of Army (12/22).

Was 7-of-13 from the field against Army with 20 points and three steals.

Shot 37.9 percent overall from behind-the-arc on the season.

Scored season-high 21 points at Clemson (12/18) including a 9-of-10 performance at the free throw line.

Had one double figure outing in SEC play, scoring 12 points vs. Florida (1/15) on 5-of-9 shooting.

2020-21 (Murray State)

Saw action in all 26 games and started the final nine for the Racers.

Averaged 12.7 points per game for the season and 1.9 assists.

In the final nine games, he scored 16.9 points per game on 51.8 percent shooting, including 37.0 percent from three-point range.

Set his career-high three times with a 21-point scoring game vs. Jacksonville State (1/21), 23 points vs. Eastern Kentucky (2/6) and 27 points against Tennessee Tech (2/27).

2019-20 (Murray State)

Helped the Racers to a regular season conference championship.

Played in 22 games with two starts, despite battling injuries.

Scored 6.3 points per game and dished out 51 assists.

Had six games of double-figure scoring and two of the final three games of the season.

Had a season-high 20 points against Brescia (11/16).

High School

Played at Cardinal Newman School in Columbia, S.C. where he graduated as the programs all-time leading scorer with 1,868 points.

Averaged 24.5 points, 5.6 rebounds and 4.0 assists per game as a senior while leading Cardinal Newman to the state title.

As a junior, averaged 21.8 points, 5.2 rebounds and 4.7 assists per game.

Personal

Both of his parents, Chico Sr. and Kitty, played basketball at Morris College.

Chico Sr. also starred in baseball, garnering freshman of the year, all-region and all-conference accoldaes all four years before being drafted by the Atlanta Braves in 1990.

Kitty also starred on the court, earning freshman of the year honors in 1985.

Sister, Cierra, had a standout career on the court for Furman (2015-18), earning several accolades including SoCon All-Freshman Team and All-SoCon Second Team honors as a junior and senior. Finished her career ranked 11th in Paladin history in scoring with 1,383 career points and fifth in rebounding with 859 rebounds.
